repnme.cdata!:
Nigeria - Economic Management Technical
            Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the project outcome was
            satisfactory, and sustainability is likely. Nonetheless,
            design flaws made project implementation problematic, and
            the failure of the project to designate responsibility, and
            authority to a specific department at the early stages, was
            conducive to the absence of ownership. This led to a
            significant shift, when implementation responsibility was
            defined, and efficiently handled, and the performance of the
            Borrower, improved dramatically. However, infrequent, and
            inadequate Bank supervision, failed to include training, and
            financial management support, during early critical stages
            of implementation. The lessons learned reinforce once again,
            that technical assistance lending (TAL) instruments, do not
            provide broad strategies to address various weaknesses, or
            systemic problems in critical areas. Thus, it is suggested
            that future TAL projects, could provide procurement clinics,
            and workshops - prior to effectiveness - for participating
            agencies, and stakeholders. The project also conveyed the
            need to establish an annual review process, in order to
            enhance a positive interaction among the Borrower, its
            implementing agencies, and the Bank, to minimize
            implementation difficulties. The need for adequate
            institutional development is addressed, to achieve flawless
            internal controls in reporting requirements, financial
            management, and auditing procedures.

18154989.theme: State-owned enterprise restructuring and privatization,Public expenditure, financial management and procurement,Administrative and civil service reform,Macroeconomic management
18154989.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Economic management,Public sector governance

repnme.cdata!:
Nigeria - Economic Management Technical
            Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project will support the
            government's efforts in the areas of fiscal management
            and privatization and commercialization. The project
            comprises the following three components: fiscal management;
            privatization and commercialization and institutional
            support and studies. For fiscal management, assistance will
            be provided to departments under the Federal Ministry of
            Finance to improve the budgetary process, in revenue
            collection and expenditure controls, national accounting
            operations and tax policies. The privatization and
            commercialization component provides support to facilitate
            the implementation of public enterprise reforms through
            assistance to the Technical Committee for Privatization and
            Commercialization, to the Ministry of Finance Incorporated,
            or to any other agency. Assistance will also be provided to
            the Utility Charges Commission, the regulatory body for
            utility tariffs, and to parastatal agencies to assist in
            implementing their transition to private/commercialized
            entities. The institutional support and studies component
            will provide funds to agencies as they develop their
            programs within the overall objectives of the project, in
            areas such as public expenditure control, financial sector
            management, civil service reform, poverty alleviation and
            gender aspects.
